revised_title: Influence of Atomic Grouping on Absorption in Infra-Red Region of Organic Molecules
tldr: The authors investigate the influence of atomic grouping in the molecules of organic bodies on their absorption in the infra-red region of the spectrum. They find that substances can be grouped according to their absorption spectra, and that this grouping aligns with the chemical grouping of compounds. The research focuses on the longer waves of the spectrum, as they are more likely to be affected by complex bodies than shorter waves.
